sen.j: 田形皇女（たかたのひめみこ、天武天皇3年（674年） - 神亀5年（728年）3月5日）は、天武天皇の皇女。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Takata (674 - March 5, 728) was a daughter of Emperor Tenmu.
The Imperial Princess Takata (674 - March 5, 728) was a princess of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。daughter→princess と修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Takata (674 - April 22, 728) was a princess of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 他の箇所がグレゴリオ歴に変更されているので、それに合わせて、April 22としました。

sen.e: Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the ise shrine)
Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: the ise shrine→Ise-jingu Shrine と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: Saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 母は蘇我赤兄の娘の大蕤娘。
sen.e: Her mother was Onu no iratsume, a daughter of SOGA no Akae.
Her mother was Onu no iratsume, a daughter of SOGA no Akae.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Her mother was Onu no iratsume, a daughter of SOGA no Akae.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母兄姉に穂積親王、紀皇女がいる。
sen.e: She had an elder brother-uterine, Prince Hozumi, and an elder sister-uterine, Kino himemiko (Princess Ki).
She had an older brother-uterine, the Prince Hozumi, and an older sister-uterine, Kino himemiko (the Princess Ki).
sen.cmt: elder→older と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She had an older brother-uterine, the Prince Hozumi, and an older sister-uterine, Kino himemiko (the Princess Ki).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 慶雲3年（706年）8月29日、退下した泉皇女の跡を継ぐ形で斎王として伊勢に下向した。
sen.e: On August 29, 706, Princess Takata took over the position of Saio (an unmarried female relative of a Japanese emperor, serving at Ise Grand Shrine) from Princess Izumi, and left the capital for Ise Province.

On October 14, 706, the Princess Takata took over the position of Saio (an unmarried female relative of a Japanese emperor, serving at Ise Grand Shrine [Ise-jingu Shrine]) from the Princess Izumi, and left the capital for Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 慶雲3年（706年）8月29日→西暦706年10月14日と修正しました。the を補いました。[Ise-jingu Shrine]を補いました。
sen.e: On October 14, 706, the Princess Takata took over the position of Saio (an unmarried female relative of a Japanese emperor, serving at Ise Grand Shrine [Ise-jingu Shrine]) from the Princess Izumi, and left the capital for Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 退下して平城京に帰った時期は明らかではないが、おそらく慶雲4年（707年）の6月15日に文武天皇が崩御した後と思われる。
sen.e: It's not known exactly when she retired from Saio and returned to Heijo-kyo, but it's believed to be after the demise of Emperor Monmu on June 15, 707.
It is not known exactly when she retired from Saio and returned to Heijo-kyo, but it is believed to be after the demise of the Emperor Monmu on July 22, 707.
sen.cmt: 慶雲4年（707年）の6月15日→西暦707年7月22日と修正しました。it's→it is と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: It is not known exactly when she retired from Saio and returned to Heijo-kyo, but it is believed to be after the demise of the Emperor Monmu on July 22, 707.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 時期は不明だが平城京に帰った後、六人部王と結婚し、後に歌人となる笠縫女王を生んだ。
sen.e: It's also unknown when, but after she returned to Heijo-kyo, she married Mutobe no o, and gave birth to Princess KASA no Nui who grew up to be one of great court poets.
It is also unknown when, but after she returned to Heijo-kyo, she married Mutobe no o, and gave birth to the Princess KASA no Nui who grew up to be one of the great court poets.
sen.cmt: It's→It is と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: It is also unknown when, but after she returned to Heijo-kyo, she married Mutobe no o, and gave birth to the Princess KASA no Nui who grew up to be one of the great court poets.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神亀元年（724年）の2月6日に、三品に叙せられる。
sen.e: She was conferred Sanbon (third order) on February 6, 724.
She was conferred Sanbon (the third rank of the imperial princes' rank) on March 9, 724.
sen.cmt: 神亀元年（724年）の2月6日→西暦724年3月9日と修正しました。カッコ部分を修正しました。
sen.e: She was conferred Sanbon (the third rank of the imperial princes' rank) on March 9, 724.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: She died on March 5, 728.
She died on March 5, 728.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She died on April 225, 728.
sen.cmt: 他の箇所がグレゴリオ歴に変更されているので、それに合わせて、April 22としました。

sen.j: 田形皇女自身は歌を残していないが、夫の六人部王と娘の笠縫女王の歌が『万葉集』に残されている。
sen.e: Princess Takata did not write poetry, but "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of poetry) contained the poems written by her husband, Mutobe no o and her daughter, Princess KASA no Nui.
There is no poetry by the Princess Takata found, but "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of poetry) contained the poems written by her husband, Mutobe no o and her daughter, the Princess KASA no Nui.
sen.cmt: Princess Takata did not write poetry→There is no poetry by the Princess Takata found と修正しました。（ここでは”歌が残っていない”という意味合いが強いとして修正しました）the を補いました。
sen.e: There is no poetry by the Princess Takata found, but "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of poetry) contained the poems written by her husband, Mutobe no o and her daughter, the Princess KASA no Nui.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
